segment.source: Declare background tasks in the application manifest
segment.target: Declare background tasks in the application manifest

segment.source: Enable the use of background tasks by declaring them as extensions in the app manifest.
segment.target: Enable the use of background tasks by declaring them as extensions in the app manifest.

segment.source: Declare background tasks in the application manifest
segment.target: Declare background tasks in the application manifest

segment.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive

segment.source: Important APIs
segment.target: Important APIs

segment.source: BackgroundTasks Schema
segment.target: BackgroundTasks Schema

segment.source: Windows.ApplicationModel.Background
segment.target: Windows.ApplicationModel.Background

segment.source: Enable the use of background tasks by declaring them as extensions in the app manifest.
segment.target: Enable the use of background tasks by declaring them as extensions in the app manifest.

segment.source: Background tasks but be declared in the app manifest or else your app will not be able to register them (an exception will be thrown).
segment.target: Background tasks but be declared in the app manifest or else your app will not be able to register them (an exception will be thrown).

segment.source: Additionally, background tasks must be declared in the application manifest to pass certification.
segment.target: Additionally, background tasks must be declared in the application manifest to pass certification.

segment.source: This topic assumes you have a created one or more background task classes, and that your app registers each background task to run in response to at least one trigger.
segment.target: This topic assumes you have a created one or more background task classes, and that your app registers each background task to run in response to at least one trigger.

segment.source: Add Extensions Manually
segment.target: Add Extensions Manually

segment.source: Open the application manifest (Package.appxmanifest) and go to the Application element.
segment.target: Open the application manifest (Package.appxmanifest) and go to the Application element.

segment.source: Create an Extensions element (if one doesn't already exist).
segment.target: Create an Extensions element (if one doesn't already exist).

segment.source: The following snippet is taken from the background task sample:
segment.target: The following snippet is taken from the background task sample:

segment.source: Add a Background Task Extension
segment.target: Add a Background Task Extension

segment.source: Declare your first background task.
segment.target: Declare your first background task.

segment.source: Copy this code into the Extensions element (you will add attributes in the following steps).
segment.target: Copy this code into the Extensions element (you will add attributes in the following steps).

segment.source: Change the EntryPoint attribute to have the same string used by your code as the entry point when registering your background task (namespace.classname).
segment.target: Change the EntryPoint attribute to have the same string used by your code as the entry point when registering your background task (namespace.classname).

segment.source: In this example, the entry point is ExampleBackgroundTaskNameSpace.ExampleBackgroundTaskClassName:
segment.target: In this example, the entry point is ExampleBackgroundTaskNameSpace.ExampleBackgroundTaskClassName:

segment.source: Change the list of Task Type attribute to indicate the type of task registration used with this background task.
segment.target: Change the list of Task Type attribute to indicate the type of task registration used with this background task.

segment.source: If the background task is registered with multiple trigger types, add additional Task elements and Type attributes for each one.
segment.target: If the background task is registered with multiple trigger types, add additional Task elements and Type attributes for each one.

segment.source: Note Make sure to list each of the trigger types you're using, or the background task will not register with the undeclared trigger types (the Register method will fail and throw an exception).
segment.target: Note Make sure to list each of the trigger types you're using, or the background task will not register with the undeclared trigger types (the Register method will fail and throw an exception).

segment.source: This snippet example indicates the use of system event triggers and push notifications:
segment.target: This snippet example indicates the use of system event triggers and push notifications:

segment.source: Note Normally, an app will run in a special process called "BackgroundTaskHost.exe".
segment.target: Note Normally, an app will run in a special process called "BackgroundTaskHost.exe".

segment.source: It is possible to add an Executable element to the Extension element, allowing the background task to run in the context of the app.
segment.target: It is possible to add an Executable element to the Extension element, allowing the background task to run in the context of the app.

segment.source: Only use the Executable element with background tasks that require it, such as the ControlChannelTrigger.
segment.target: Only use the Executable element with background tasks that require it, such as the ControlChannelTrigger.

segment.source: Add Additional Background Task Extensions
segment.target: Add Additional Background Task Extensions

segment.source: Repeat step 2 for each additional background task class registered by your app.
segment.target: Repeat step 2 for each additional background task class registered by your app.

segment.source: The following example is the complete Application element from the background task sample.
segment.target: The following example is the complete Application element from the background task sample.

segment.source: This shows the use of 2 background task classes with a total of 3 trigger types.
segment.target: This shows the use of 2 background task classes with a total of 3 trigger types.

segment.source: Copy the Extensions section of this example, and modify it as needed, to declare background tasks in your application manifest.
segment.target: Copy the Extensions section of this example, and modify it as needed, to declare background tasks in your application manifest.
